materials.raw_text:
1. Potassium (K) - 180 g (from potassium nitrate or potassium sulfate) 
 2. Manganese (Mn) - 120 g (from manganese dioxide) 
 3. Phosphorus (P) - 80 g (from phosphorus pentoxide) 
 4. Oxygen (O) - 240 g (from sources like potassium permanganate) 
 5. Water - 500 g (distilled)

sourcing.instructions:
1. Potassium compounds can be sourced from chemical supply stores or online suppliers. 
 2. Manganese dioxide is available at chemical supply stores or online. 
 3. Phosphorus pentoxide can be obtained from specialized chemical suppliers. 
 4. Potassium permanganate is commonly available at chemical supply stores. 
 5. Distilled water can be found at grocery stores or pharmacies.

preparation.raw_text:
1. In a clean, dry container, measure out 180 g of potassium. 
 2. Add 120 g of manganese dioxide to the container. 
 3. Carefully incorporate 80 g of phosphorus pentoxide into the mixture. 
 4. Slowly add 240 g of potassium permanganate, ensuring even distribution. 
 5. Gradually mix in 500 g of distilled water until a homogeneous paste is formed.
